qas.question: Who was the person that tried Jesus?
How long was Jesus hung for?
What did the sign say on top of Jesus' cross?

answers.text: Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews

qas.question: What was done to make sure Jesus was dead?

answers.text: they pierced his side with a spear

qas.question: How many statements did Jesus make on the cross?
Who did Pontius Pilate believe that he was?
What did soldiers do to Christians as a punishment?
What is one thing that Pilate used to drink?
What did Pilate take from Jesus after winning a bet?
How many statements did the Romans make about Christians?

context: According to the canonical gospels, Jesus, whom Christians believe to be the Son of God as well as <b5_0>the Messiah<b5_0/> (Christ), was arrested, tried, and sentenced by <a0_0>Pontius Pilate<a0_0/> to be scourged, and finally <b6_0>crucified<b6_0/> by the Romans. Jesus was stripped of his clothing and offered <b7_0>wine mixed with gall<b7_0/> to drink, before being crucified. He was then hung for <a1_0>six hours<a1_0/> (according to Mark's Gospel) between two convicted thieves. During this time, the soldiers affixed a sign to the top of the cross stating "<a2_0>Jesus of Nazareth, King of the Jews<a2_0/>" in three languages. They then divided his garments among them, but cast lots for <b8_0>his seamless robe<b8_0/>. After Jesus' death <a3_0>they pierced his side with a spear<a3_0/> to be certain that he had died. The Bible records <a4_0><b9_0>seven<b9_0/> statements<a4_0/> that Jesus made while he was on the cross, as well as several supernatural events that occurred.
